definition: to take off/to remove (one's hat, a door from its hinges etc)/to pick (a piece of fruit from a tree etc)/(sports) to pick off (a rebound etc)
to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: An elephant can uproot a tree or pick a flower without bruising a petal.
sentences.chinese: 大象能够拔起大树，或者摘下小花而不损伤花瓣。

sentences.english: I plucked all the blossom in my garden into wreaths.
sentences.chinese: 我摘下我花园中所有的娇艳，把它们织成各个桂冠们。

sentences.english: She won the championship with a performance of 13-under in the four rounds.
sentences.chinese: 她并以4轮低于标准杆13杆的成绩顺利摘下后冠。

sentences.english: Quickly, I unhooked the receiver and held it to my ear.
sentences.chinese: 我飞快摘下了听筒，贴在耳朵上。

sentences.english: My hat of general boy is taken off , is execute juggle for a short time, throw a shape besides doing the past window.
sentences.chinese: 我将男孩的帽子摘下，小施手技，作往窗外投掷状。

sentences.english: And the king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it unto Mordecai.
sentences.chinese: 王摘下自己的戒指，就是从哈曼追回的，给了末底改。

sentences.english: Willing hands held my bike and helped me get my backpack off.
sentences.chinese: 那些热心人帮我扶着车，又帮我把背包摘下来。

sentences.english: How would you like to have one of them skysails round your neck?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意摘下一个天帆戴在你的脖子上吗？

sentences.english: She plucked some leaves off the sapling.
sentences.chinese: 她从树苗上摘下一些叶子。

sentences.english: Pleae take off you coat , necklace and earrings, then put on this dress.
sentences.chinese: 请你脱下外衣，摘下项链和耳环，然后穿上这件衣服。

sentences.english: He took off his rucksack and placed the sample inside.
sentences.chinese: 他摘下自己的帆布包，把样品放进包里。

sentences.english: Finally I set the mig down and pulled up my mask to get a look at the sculpture.
sentences.chinese: 最后我放下焊管，摘下面具来看雕塑。

sentences.english: Pull the leaves from the outside of the planting so the inside leaves will keep growing.
sentences.chinese: 把生菜外面的叶子摘下来，这样里面叶子能继续生长。

sentences.english: The king took off his crown and put it on the Star-Child's head.
sentences.chinese: 国王摘下他的王冠戴在星子的头上。

sentences.english: Will you clamber up, and pluck it to show to papa?
sentences.chinese: 你要不要爬上去，把它摘下来给爸爸看？

sentences.english: On your way, try to find a blade of beautiful grass and pick it up and then give it to me.
sentences.chinese: 在你走的时候，请尝试找一束美草，摘下来并交给我。

definition: to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
to fish out/to take out (from a pocket, bag etc)
to remove/to take off/to strip off/to discard/to shed/to come off/to fall off
to push aside/to part/to brush away
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
